item.title: Generalizable Diffuion via Stochastic Interpolants
item.description: Hey guys! Recently, I’ve been interested in novel generative techniques. We’ve seen the advent of diffusion over the past few years, from DDPM to diffusion transformers. Diffusion transformers are the gold standard for modern-day image generation, and there has been a lot of research on using diffusion for language modeling, sparked by the famous LLaDa model. Newer advancements include hybrid LLMs built on “Block Diffusion” to take advantage of diffusion’s parallel token generation whilst utilizing autoregression’s flexible-length generation and KV Caching.
